parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
(a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures. A document, i.e. Holy Writ.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A corner; met: a secret place. Probably akin to gonu; an angle.
